User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the ScriptScribbler application.

authorId.description: Reference to the User who created the script. (Relationship: User 1:N Script)

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the script was created.

lastModified.description: Timestamp indicating when the script was last modified.

Scene.title: Scene
Scene.description: Represents a scene within a script.

scriptId.description: Reference to the Script this scene belongs to. (Relationship: Script 1:N Scene)

sceneNumber.description: The scene number within the script.

content.description: The content of the scene (e.g., scene description, dialogue).

estimatedDuration.description: Estimated duration of the scene in minutes.

Character.title: Character
Character.description: Represents a character in a screenplay.

userId.description: The ID of the user who owns this character.

description.description: A short, one-line description of the character.

profile.description: A detailed profile of the character, including backstory, personality, motivations, etc.

imageUrl.description: URL for the character's portrait image.

scenes.description: The number of scenes the character appears in.

Collaboration.title: Collaboration
Collaboration.description: Represents a collaboration session for a script.

id.description: Unique identifier for the collaboration session.

scriptId.description: Reference to the Script being collaborated on. (Relationship: Script 1:N Collaboration)

userId.description: Reference to the User participating in the collaboration. (Relationship: User 1:N Collaboration)

role.description: Role of the user in the collaboration (e.g., writer, editor, viewer).

permissions.description: Permissions granted to the user in the collaboration (e.g., edit, view, comment).

SceneCharacter.title: SceneCharacter
SceneCharacter.description: Represents the relationship between a scene and characters appearing in it.  This is an N:N join table between Scene and Character

id.description: Unique identifier for the scene character relationship.

sceneId.description: Reference to the Scene. (Relationship: Scene N:N Character)

characterId.description: Reference to the Character. (Relationship: Character N:N Scene)

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user.

definition.description: Stores characters owned by a specific user. Path-based ownership ensures only the user can access these scripts.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user.

params.name: characterId
params.description: The unique identifier for the character.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to ensure security, scalability, and debuggability. The structure has been simplified to directly associate characters with users (`/users/{userId}/characters/{characterId}`). This provides clear, path-based ownership, making it easy to write security rules that allow a user to only access their own characters. This is more efficient for the current requirements than a more complex, multi-level script-based structure.
